Basic data types in R can be divided into the following types:

    numeric - (10.5, 55, 787)
    integer - (1L, 55L, 100L, where the letter "L" declares this as an integer)
    complex - (9 + 3i, where "i" is the imaginary part)
    character (a.k.a. string) - ("k", "R is exciting", "FALSE", "11.5")
    logical (a.k.a. boolean) - (TRUE or FALSE)


```{r}
# numeric
a = 10.44
class(a)
a = 10;class(a)
a = 9+ 1i; class(a)
a = "k dsds" ;class(a) 
a = TRUE
```

```{r}
i = 1;
while(i <10){
    i = i+1
    if(i%%2 == 0) next

    print(i)
}
fruits =  c(2,2,3,4) # all num

for(i in fruits){
    print(i)
}

fruits =  c("2",2,3,4) # all character even if one str

for(i in fruits){
    print(i)
}



fruits =  list("2",2,3,4) # as specified no change

for(i in fruits){
    print(i)
}
```
